paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Patients from endemic regions including Portugal, Japan, Sweden, Mallorca-Spain, and Cyprus.
patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) characterized by progressive sensory, autonomic, and motor neuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The TTR mutation causes misfolding, aggregation, and deposition of amyloid fibrils, leading to progressive multisystemic dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical presentation and familial segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the main responsible for the disease in endemic regions.
key_quotes: Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy is caused by a missense point mutation that leads to a single nucleotide substitution (adenine to guanine) in exon 2 of the TTR gene.
This mutation is the main responsible for the disease in endemic regions.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted all relevant information regarding the TTR gene variant Val30Met.
